text: Nickel(II) hydroxide, also known as nickelous hydroxide, is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is Ni(OH)2. It contains nickel in its +2 oxidation state. It also contains hydroxide ions. ==Properties== It is a light green solid. It does not dissolve in water. It dissolves in acids to make other nickel(II) salts. ==Preparation== It is made by reacting a base containing hydroxide ions with a nickel(II) salt, such as nickel(II) chloride. ==Uses== Nickel(II) hydroxide is used in the nickel cadmium battery and the nickel-metal hydride battery. ==Related pages== *Nickel(II) nitrate *Nickel(II) sulfate Category:Nickel compounds
title: Nickel(II) hydroxide
